result.execSummary:
The defendant Bill Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse programs.
Concurrent with: With any sentence now serving

superMiscConds.notes:
COMPAS Evaluation and follow through.
Submit DNA sample when defendant reports to jail. 
Comply with any conditions imposed by agent/Dept. of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
